entry.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
entry.content:
As an update on Splunk Storm, since we have been using it in sort-of-production, we suffered another 3-day “locked out of account” outage last week where our data was still being logged but we couldn’t access it and currently the API input has been turned off for over 20 hours while they troubleshoot a problem. We have received emails that they intend to start charging for the service in September with the lowest account level continuing to be free.

I also ran into an issue where multiple log messages sent via separate API calls would get combined into a single long message. It seems the way to prevent this from happening is to always start your log message with the time entry and to use one of the “type” codes and formats that they provide in the documentation (which I had assumed were just examples). I thought this was rather sloppy, since they are in effect combining things that are reported in separate HTTP API calls and should probably fix that logic, but that was the feedback I received.

entry.title: By: Alex Munk
entry.content:
Hey Eli,

Thanks for using Splunk Storm and including it in your review. Sorry to hear it hasn’t been so smooth. We are aware of the issues that you’ve pointed out. Our team is actively working on them and has delivered fixes for some of them already, such as the 404 timeout issue.

Splunk is committed to delivering a high quality, reliable, elastic, pay-as-you-go service that people can trust with their IT and business data. We welcome any additional feedback you may have.

Alex Munk
Splunk Storm Team
